revised_title: Wind-Generated Topographic Waves in Stratified Elliptical Basins
tldr: The authors present a theory for wind generation of topographic waves in a stratified, elongated lake. They apply this theory to the Lake of Lugano, Switzerland, and find that the observed oscillations in temperature and current records can be explained by a fundamental-mode topographic wave traveling around the lake. The energy source for this wave is likely the wind along the shore at the southern end of the lake.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
